name: Napasai by Orient-Express

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a beach front villa for 5 night for our honeymoon. It was picture perfect. The villa's were amazing. The staff was incredibly attentive. Food was wonderful. I would highly recommend this as a honeymoon destination. I was a little disappointed in Koh Samui. I was expecting it to be a little more upscale or nicer. However, if you're looking for a relaxing, tropical vacation, you can't go wrong with staying on the grounds of Napasi.
reviews.title: Just perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From amazing rooms to sublime service everything is just five star!
reviews.title: Simply stunning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sorry but Koh Samui is a bit of a dump! I am sure it was wonderful ten to twenty years ago but the uncontrolled building all round the coast has taken away most of any inherent charm. Chaweng has a great beach but frankly is pretty tacky with little to commend it other than a few good restaurants, mainly along one small street. The potential trips out are little better ,with the highlights being the pretty unspectacular waterfalls and the rather gaudy wats that manage to be as touristy as the island and the sad elephant rides with half starved dusty, tiny, below par elephants. Sorry but apart from a few clubs can anyone tell me why one would come here?
reviews.title: Gilded cage

likes.disliked: — The poor English of the Front desk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well I can suggest a couple of answers.
reviews.title: The best ever

likes.liked: — Spacious, spotlessly clean, great bathroom products - like everything

reviews.text: Firstly, the weather is fantastic and the rains come later then anywhere else in Thailand and most places in SE Asia.
reviews.title: The best hotel on the island

likes.disliked: — The cost of the Thai food in the restaurant

reviews.text: Nice location on effectively a smallish private beach, but with a long beach just around the corner. We were fortunate to be in a cottage, which had a second bedroom and bathroom so ideal for a family, and also had a sala in the garden area.
reviews.title: Quiet and restful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very pleasant and cheerful staff, from the waiters to the beach staff, and a choice of restaurants for dinner, either by the beach or the main restaurant higher up. Bicycles for rent (no charge) so good to potter around the local lanes, or cycle along the main road into the local town. Samui is now undoubtedly a busy touristy place, but the Napasai, on the nothern part of the island, and with its own big grounds, will appeal if you're looking for a quiet time and appreciate the Orient Express Hotels style.
reviews.title: Fantastic Napasai

likes.liked: — The beauty of the property, it felt very exclusive and the staff were amazingly attentive.
likes.disliked: — The fisherman's boats located nearby disturbing our sleep

reviews.title: Napasai = True Samui Paradise
reviews.text: My husband and I just arrived back from 8 nights at the blissful Napasai in Koh Samui. From the moment we arrived, we felt cocooned by beautiful surroundings, blissful views and fantastically attentive staff... It was really just what we both craved - as we were looking for a chilled holiday.

reviews.title: Napasai = True Samui Paradise
reviews.text: The property is a little further from places like Fisherman's Village (about a 10 minute taxi ride) and Chaweng (approx. 15 minutes taxi), but this really gave us the opportunity to enjoy our surroundings - whilst having the opportunity to dip into nightlife outside the hotel - should we want to. The hotel runs different dining options throughout the week - i.e. thai dancing dinner show/candilit dinner by the beach/pool - to name but a few - so you won't be stumped for dining options. Breakfast is hearty and plentiful. We booked on a B&B basis - so ate a huge breakkie - which saw us through most of the day before we dined out in the evening. We ate at several restaurants outside the hotel - but we choose to return twice to Zazen - which was very pretty, served great food and very reasonably priced. We were, however, disappointed by the price of wine in Thailand - an average bottle which costs approx. £15 back in the UK would be double that in most restaurants...I guess because most of them are imported - but if you're like me and love a bottle of wine to share at dinner - dining could become quite expensive. Spirits and cocktails are a cheaper option.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked with the hotel direct - who were running a promotion - stay 7 nights and receive one free and we checked into a Hillside Seaview Cottage which was beautiful. The room was huge and felt very Japanese - with sliding teak doors seprating bathroom/living room. Our terrace gave us glorious views of the sea and the opportunity to chill after a full day on the beach - not to mention enjoying the balmy nights.
reviews.title: True Beach Resort--Incredible Stay

reviews.text: The two drawbacks first: the sea access was quite difficult when we were staying at the Napasai: only possible to swim at high tide :-/ And the scuba diving that requires a one hour speed boat to get to the spots (like from any other hotel in Koh Samui).
reviews.title: Paradise on earth

likes.disliked: — The beach access at low tide

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the rest was perfect, from the pick-up at the airport to the drop off.
reviews.title: Napasai Heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel entrance is almost at the top of the resort allowing an overall view on the huge infinity pool, the beach and the sea, the two restaurants (both excellent), the bar and several bungalows. The staff was attentive and efficient, from the reception to the housekeeping, a sign of very good hotel management. The spa was all right and massages up to it. Bungalows are spacious, made of top quality material, with all amenities you can expect from a ***** resort, some of them having a large leaving room where children can comfortably sleep. And the hotel is organising all sort of activities, from scuba diving tests to excursions or games on the beach. Not to forget of course the nice infinity pool where we could chill out, get some lunch and some drinks...
reviews.title: relaxing and luxurious

likes.disliked: — location for restaurants and night life

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In short, we spent two weeks in paradise...
reviews.title: the best hotel ever!!

likes.liked: — the pool ,the polite and helpfull staff,the amasing room view
likes.disliked: — they didnt have a 24hour room service

reviews.text: Just returned from our trip around the Far East (Thailand, Singapore, Hong Kong) and can't say enough about how wonderful Napasai was, the surroundings, the staff and the quiet comfort of a truly wonderfull hotel. From our greeting with cold drinks and chilled towels on arrival through the sumtious breakfast and the ever attentive beach/pool staff to the wonderous dinners in the main or the beachside restaurant everything is done to make you feel special. I've read other reviews which describe it as a "Gilded Cage" given the "reality" of the rest of Ko Samui - I disagree! if you're prepared to spend time and look there are some wonderful restaurants and bars around and a little bit of reading will winkle them out. Best part of all was the people - always warm and welcoming with food, from the best retaurants to the lowest street stall, to die for. Yes the "tourist attractions are a little amaturish but that has it's own charm and any issues are easily smoothed over with a smile.
reviews.title: Special Occasion

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Napasai for a 3 night period in the middle of a rather hectic travel schedule - and it felt as if we had been transported to another world. After being collected at the ferry port, we took a short drive to Napasai resort which is at the north of Koh Samui situated on their private beach. We were welcomed with cold towels and refreshments, before being led to our beautiful sea view cottage. The cottages really allow you some privacy - you feel separate from the rest of the resort. We spent a few evenings enjoying the sunset from our cottage's balcony.
reviews.title: Paradise at Napasai

likes.disliked: — There was no wi fi in our cottage, but there was in the communal areas.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fresh fruit was delivered to our room, and the breakfast buffet was large and offered everything you can think of, including local dishes which were great to try. We also impressed by the room service which we used one evening. Dining in the Lai Thai restaurant at night was beautiful - watching the reflection of the moon and trees over the infinity pool. We also ate at the beachfront restaurant for lunch once, and had cocktails on our deckchairs from the pool bar - we were impressed with the standard of food/drink, and especially the service we received all around the resort. The staff were really helpful and suggested things to see on the island on the day we rented one of the small bikes to get around the island. They also helped set up a windsurfer for my partner to try at the beach - nothing was too much trouble.
reviews.title: Heaven on Earth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't have a chance to try any spa treatments, but they looked tempting. We spent any spare time we had lapping up the view from a deckchair on the beach, or around the pool. It was always tough to choose between them... Unfortunately we were only there for 3 nights - I wish it had been longer. The weather was perfect - cool in the evenings, and probably around 30 degrees in the day - I think February was a great time to go.
reviews.title: Serene and Stylish

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beauty of the location, and the peaceful atmosphere at Napasai set it apart from the other places we visited.
reviews.title: A pretty nice stay at Napasai

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 10 nights at Napasai... and would have stayed longer if we could! We spent our honeymoon there and would recommend it to anyone who wants a romantic or special place to get away to. It is close enough to the local shops and buzz but far enough away that you could be on a desert island. The bungalows are beautiful and large with enormous beds and a relaxing inside and outside day beds.
reviews.title: Blissful and serene

likes.disliked: — THE INTERNET ACCESS COULD BE IMPROVED.. ONE COMPUTER FOR THE WHOLE RESORT IS NOT GOOD ENOUGH FOR A TOP END RESORT

aka: Napasai By Orient-Express Hotel Mae Nam
description: Napasai Beach Resort & Villas in Koh Samui, Thailand is a secluded luxury beach resort in Maenam Beach, on the fashionable north coast of Koh Samui. Accommodation comprises a selection of beautiful Koh Samui-style private cottages, some with private pools, and two and three bedroom private pool luxury villas for rental and sale.
